body_html:
@ilblackdragon I am not showing SKCompat as part of TensorFlow 1.0. Was scikit-learn compatibility dropped? I tried your same instructions on TF 1.0 (you used rc2) and I get:

>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.contrib.learn.SKCompat
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'tensorflow.contrib.learn' has no attribute 'SKCompat'
>>> tf.__version__
'1.0.0'
>>>

Yet, in 1.0.0 I still get warnings telling me to use SKCompat. Very confused.

Estimator is decoupled from Scikit Learn interface by moving into
separate class SKCompat. Arguments x, y and batch_size are only
available in the SKCompat class, Estimator will only accept input_fn.
Example conversion:
  est = Estimator(...) -> est = SKCompat(Estimator(...))

I am using it as follows, let me know if this is not correct. I am following the instructions from the warning above:

    feature_columns = [tf.contrib.layers.real_valued_column("", dimension=x.shape[0])]
    model = learn.DNNRegressor(
        model_dir=model_dir,
        feature_columns=feature_columns,
        hidden_units=HIDDEN_UNITS)

    # Make TensorFlow model behave like scikit-learn
    model = learn.SKCompat(model)

body:
@ilblackdragon I am not showing SKCompat as part of TensorFlow 1.0.  Was scikit-learn compatibility dropped?  I tried your same instructions on TF 1.0 (you used rc2) and I get:

```
>>> import tensorflow as tf
>>> tf.contrib.learn.SKCompat
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: module 'tensorflow.contrib.learn' has no attribute 'SKCompat'
>>> tf.__version__
'1.0.0'
>>>
```

Yet, in 1.0.0 I still get warnings telling me to use SKCompat.  Very confused.

```
Estimator is decoupled from Scikit Learn interface by moving into
separate class SKCompat. Arguments x, y and batch_size are only
available in the SKCompat class, Estimator will only accept input_fn.
Example conversion:
  est = Estimator(...) -> est = SKCompat(Estimator(...))
```

I am using it as follows, let me know if this is not correct.  I am following the instructions from the warning above:

```
    feature_columns = [tf.contrib.layers.real_valued_column("", dimension=x.shape[0])]
    model = learn.DNNRegressor(
        model_dir=model_dir,
        feature_columns=feature_columns,
        hidden_units=HIDDEN_UNITS)

    # Make TensorFlow model behave like scikit-learn
    model = learn.SKCompat(model)
```
